content.question: The graph of the function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> defined on the closed interval <math alttext="open bracket, negative 2 comma 2, close bracket" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is shown above. Let <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be defined by <math alttext="g of x, equals, the integral from, 0 to x, of, f of t, d t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. On which of the following intervals is the graph of <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> both decreasing and concave up?

choices.label: <math alttext="open parenthesis, negative 2 comma negative 1, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, negative 1 comma 0, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 6.5: Interpreting the Behavior of Accumulation Functions Involving Area

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
